intro: Sida rhombifolia var. scabrida, commonly known as roughleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial species characterized by its rhombic-shaped leaves with a rough, scabrous texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the Malvaceae family. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Its fibrous stems and hairy leaves make it identifiable in its native habitats.
